title: The American Revolution
key_facts: Conflict between the 13 American colonies and Great Britain.
Declaration of Independence adopted on July 4, 1776.
France provided crucial military and financial support to the colonists.
The war effectively ended with the British surrender at Yorktown in 1781.
causes: Taxation without representation (Stamp Act, Tea Act).
Desire for self-governance and freedom from British mercantilist policies.
Influence of Enlightenment ideas (liberty, social contract).
Escalating tensions following the Boston Massacre and Boston Tea Party.
outcome: Treaty of Paris (1783) recognized US independence and defined borders.
Establishment of the United States as a federal republic with the Constitution (1787).

figures.name: George Washington
figures.role: Commander of the Continental Army and first US President.

figures.name: Thomas Jefferson
figures.role: Primary author of the Declaration of Independence.

figures.name: King George III
figures.role: Monarch of Great Britain during the conflict.

impacts: Inspired the French Revolution and Latin American independence movements.
Demonstrated that a colonial rebellion could defeat a global superpower.
Establishment of democratic ideals and separation of powers.
Continued displacement of Native American populations.
